elizabeth veldon.title: ‎ربوعُ الشّـآمِ بـروجُ العَـلا ‎تُحاكي السّـماءَ بعـالي السَّـنا
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
the ongoing bombings in Syria are being ignored by the world.
the blood of Syrians is being spilled and we look away.
the title and track listings of this album come from a verse of the Syrian national anthem:
The mountains of Syria are towers in height,
which talk with the zenith of the highest skies.
A land that is splendid with brilliant sun,
turning to a sky or almost a sky.

elizabeth veldon.title: 1. for the dead
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album was released for the trans*gender day of remembrance in 2013 but was removed due to the album having been bought by a fascist, i did not wish them associated with it.
the original text accompanying the album is as follows:
today we remember the dead, the gender variant people killed each year.
this is for them and is based upon psalm 23:
the lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
he maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.
he restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake.
yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, i will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.
surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.
began as the sun set, completed in darkness.
www.transgenderdor.org/memorializing-2013

elizabeth veldon.title: 1 (from 'three sunsets')
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is the audio for the first of three films of sunsets.
these are static shots which are created first then audio added later. this constitutes a reversal of my normal practice where I create the audio first then add the visual element afterwards.
the film is viewable on youtube at:  www.youtube.com/watch?v=TQdJt2HqfLQ&ab_channel=lostinthedrone
elizabeth veldon.credits:
released October 29, 2021
I couldn't have done this without the help of ben thompson, film equipment technician at napier university who gave me invaluable advice on the correct camera to use.

elizabeth veldon.title: さくら さくら (18 cherry blossoms for H)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this piece is dedicated to a friend who fled hong kong and with whom i promised to celebrate the cherry blossom festival.
thew title, in romanised script, is 'Sakuru Sakuru' which is a Japanese folks song about the cherry blossom festival.
this piece uses sonic pi as this allows me to select a numerical value for a note and that value is 18 after the 18 districts of hong kong.

elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this track is for those injured and killed in the tragedy still unfolding at the clutha vaults public house in glasgow where a police helicopter crashed into the roof.
this is also for their families, their friends and a city shocked by these events.
produced using a mininova, two oscillators and a mixing desk. each instrument was unplugged one channel at a time, the mixer turned off and finally the connectors pulled out.
recorded to tape 30.11.2013

trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from 19.11.2013, released November 30, 2013

elizabeth veldon.title: 30 fires for the fire spook
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album is based upon the antigonish haunting, otherwise known as the 'fire spook'
this name came about after the property of alexander macdonald, suffered over thirty fires in one day supposedly at the hands of a poltergeist
this served as the inspiration for the famous poem 'antagonist' by hughes mearns:
Yesterday, upon the stair,
I met a man who wasn’t there
He wasn’t there again today
I wish, I wish he’d go away...
When I came home last night at three
The man was waiting there for me
But when I looked around the hall
I couldn’t see him there at all!
Go away, go away, don’t you come back any more!
Go away, go away, and please don’t slam the door... (slam!)
Last night I saw upon the stair
A little man who wasn’t there
He wasn’t there again today
Oh, how I wish he’d go away...

elizabeth veldon.about:
today marks one year of lockdown in scotland, this piece is 365 seconds long.
make of that what you will.
this is specifically constructed for listening using headphones or a stereo.
i intend to create a similar piece for those who have died in my country during this pandemic.

elizabeth veldon.title: a blasted victoriana (2013 remaster)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album was originally released in may 2012 and the second half of the album was at a much lower volume than the first.
this remastered edition goes someway towards resolving these issues and is released in this anniversary autumn.
the original notes to the album are here reproduced:
this album came about as part of a call to produce music for the 2012 jack the ripper conference.
i re-imagined the ripper legend through the women who died and the society that created their poverty and homelessness and addictions.
these problems are still with us and women still die because we, as a society, do not care enough.
-with thanks to robert anderson of the ripper wiki for inspiration and encouragement.

elizabeth veldon.title: a child's war
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
all titles are taken from the testimony of eye witnesses (often the children) impacted by war.
track one contains a quote from a someone brought to europe in the kindertransport, track two is the term nazi guards used to describe children, track three is a quote from a child from Congo, track four a child who fought in the american civil war, track five a teacher watching children being evacuated to the countryside during ww2 and the final is taken from an eye witness who saw that happened when they arrived at their destination.
for victims of conflict everywhere, especially for the children.
this was released as a tour only CDr limited to ten copies.

elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
all tracks are recorded using handheld recorders or computer microphones to emphasise the presence of the artist, the body itself
let mans soule be a spheare, and then, in this,
the intelligence that moves, devotion is,
and as the other spheares, by being growne
subject to forraigne motion, lose their owne,
and being by others hurried every day,
scarce in a yeare their naturall forme obey:
pleasure or businesse, so, our soules admit
for their first mover, and are whirld by it.
hence is't, that i am carryed towards the west
this day, when my soules forme bends toward the east.
there i should see a sunne, by rising set,
and by that setting endlesse day beget;
but that christ on this crosse, did rise and fall,
sinne had eternally benighted all.
yet dare i'almost be glad, i do not see
that spectacle of too much weight for mee.
who sees gods face, that is selfe life, must dye;
what a death were it then to see god dye?
it made his owne lieutenant nature shrinke,
it made his footstoole crack, and the sunne winke.
could i behold those hands which span the Poles,
and tune all spheares at once peirc'd with those holes?
could i behold that endlesse height which is
zenith to us, and our antipodes,
humbled below us? or that blood which is
the seat of all our soules, if not of his,
made durt of dust, or that flesh which was worne
by god, for his apparell, rag'd, and torne?
if on these things I durst not looke, durst i
upon his miserable mother cast mine eye,
who was gods partner here, and furnish'd thus
halfe of that sacrifice, which ransom'd us?
though these things, as i ride, be from mine eye,
they'are present yet unto my memory,
for that looks towards them; and thou look'st towards mee,
o saviour, as thou hang'st upon the tree;
i turne my backe to thee, but to receive
corrections, till thy mercies bid thee leave.
o thinke mee worth thine anger, punish mee,
burne off my rusts, and my deformity,
restore thine Image, so much, by thy grace,
that thou may'st know mee, and i'll turne my face.
(good friday, 1613. riding westward by johndonne
cover from vir dolorum (man of sorrows), master francke

elizabeth veldon.title: a diaspora in reverse: four songs of growing up in the west coast catholic community of scotland
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
when i was a child i was barely brought up in scotland; my family and the community we belonged to held onto their irish catholic roots as a bulwark against the systems of oppression that had brought their own grand parents from ireland in the first place.
the debate happening just now in scotland about the definition of what being scottish is does not recognise the experience of immigrants and migrant workers who's children are born and brought up in scotland but at one remove from their home nation and, as such, is inherently racist and xenophobic.
i can not (nor would i wish to) speak for other communities in scotland (travellers, the roma, asian-scotish, scottish jewish people) but i can speak for the community i was brought up in.
this is my contribution to (and problematisation) of the debate about nationhood.

elizabeth veldon.title: a formal consideration of the symbolism within 'the wind among the reeds' in light of yeats' nationalism (part 1)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is the first of three albums based upon my researches for my dissertation at university back in the late 90s.
they discuss the reading of yeats' 'the wind among the reeds' as a work tied to irish nationalism, a connection made explicit in the notes which yeats provided in the first edition of the collection but removed when he prepared the book for inclusion in his post civil war 'collected poems'
the third album will be based upon readings of these notes.

trackinfo.title: credo
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.about:
I believe in one God, Father almighty,
maker of heaven and of earth,
visible of all things, and invisible.
And in one Lord Jesus Christ,
Son of God only begotten.
And of Father born before all ages.
God from God, light from light, God true from God true.
Begotten, not made, of one substance with Father,
by whom all things made were. Who for us men,
et propter nostram salutem descendit de caelis.
and for our salvation descended from heavens.
And made flesh was of Spirit Holy
of Mary Virgin. And man made was.
Crucified also for us under Pontius Pilate,
suffered, and buried was.
And he rose third day, according to Scriptures.
And he ascended into heaven, he sits at right hand of Father.
And again going to come he is with glory,
to judge living and dead,
of whose kingdom not will there be end.
And in Spirit Holy Lord, and lifegiver,
who from Father and Son proceeds.
Who with Father, and Son together is adored
nd glorified, who spoke through Prophets.
And one, holy, catholic, and Apostolic Church.
I confess one baptism for remission of sins.
And I expect resurrection of dead.
And life to come of age. Amen.
trackinfo.credits: from a mass for lucy meadows, released March 22, 2013

elizabeth veldon.title: a mountain shut within itself
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is the final part of a trilogy of poems based around the work of three female poets from scotland
Summit of Corrie Etchachan
But in the climbing ecstasy of thought,
Ere consummation, ere the final peak,
Come hours like this. Behind, the long defile,
The steep rock-path, alongside which, from under
Snow-caves, sharp-corniced, tumble the ice-cold waters.
And now, here, at the corrie’s summit, no peak,
No vision of the blue world, far, unattainable,
But this grey plateau, rock-strewn, vast, silent,
The dark loch, the toiling crags, the snow;
A mountain shut within itself, yet a world,
Immensity. So may the mind achieve,
Toiling, no vision of the infinite,
But a vast, dark and inscrutable sense
Of its own terror, its own glory and power.
Nan Shepherd

trackinfo.title: a mountain shut within itself
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from a mountain shut within itself, released January 27, 2017

elizabeth veldon.title: a night in winter (part 1)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is the first part of a two part album evoking an average (16 hour) winter night in the uk during december and january.
call it a new year album
'A Night In Winter is minimalism in the extreme – from the single and double white bar on black background in the artwork, to the drones and hums that are seemingly static throughout the pieces. It feels like you’re trapped in a particularly tense David Lynch scene, with the surrealism building as the hours rack up. Best listened to very loud, as your heartbeat starts to fully sync up with the subtle shapeshifting electronic pulses.'
mookidmusic.com/2019/01/02/hibernate-with-elizabeth-veldons-16-hour-minimal-drone-piece-a-night-in-winter/

elizabeth veldon.about:

the two albums total 16 hours.

elizabeth veldon.title: a nightingale sang in village halls (a civilian song book part 1)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is the first of (hopefully) a series of albums discussing how civilians experienced the total warfare of world war two
it uses the popular song 'a nightingale sang in berkley square' as the basis for two drone pieces interspersed with a field recording
headphones recommended.
------
But we fight for life,
we fight, they say, for breath,
or what good are your scribblings?
this – we take them with us
beyond death
-h. d. 'trilogy: the walls do not fall'

elizabeth veldon.title: a ship of ghosts brought me here
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is my first album for halloween this year and concerns the disappearance of the lighthouse operators from the flannel islands at the turn of the century.
it was claimed by some that they where taken away by a ship full of angry ghosts while the legendary 'phantoms of the seven hunters (a folkloric name for the islands) where angered by a lighthouse being built on the island
happy halloween

elizabeth veldon.title: a short note on the prevalence of anti-transgender narratives
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
i don't often make direct political points here but i have seen my friends mental health suffer greatly due to anti-trans narratives which are being disseminated in the closing days of the consultation on self id and tonight i found myself scared to go to a music event in a leftist space for fear of what people would say to me
this has to end

elizabeth veldon.title: a speck of dust set in darkness (for carl sagan)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
'Cassini spacecraft captured this rare look at Earth and its moon from Saturn orbit on July 19, 2013. Taken while performing a large wide-angle mosaic of the entire Saturn ring system, narrow-angle camera images were deliberately inserted into the sequence in order to image Earth and its moon. This is the second time that Cassini has imaged Earth from within Saturn’s shadow, and only the third time ever that our planet has been imaged from the outer solar system.
Earth is the blue point of light on the left; the moon is fainter, white, and on the right. Both are seen here through the faint, diffuse E ring of Saturn. Earth was brighter than the estimated brightness used to calculate the narrow-angle camera exposure times. Hence, information derived from the wide-angle camera images was used to process this color composite. '
www.ciclops.org/view/7695/One_Special_Day_in_the_Life_of_Planet_Earth?js=1

elizabeth veldon.title: above the city a symbol (the arthur's seat coffins)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this piece relates to the finding of seventeen miniature coffins by some boys playing around arthers seat in 1836.
Each coffin contained a handmade body. each body with individual made clothing.
Nothing has ever been discovered about these coffins and the carved bodies they contain. Theories for their existence range from memorials to the victims of burke and hare, their use in witchcraft rituals or memorials to people buried at sea.
The Coffins now reside in the national museum of scotland
A piece from The Scotsman going into more detail of their finding is included in the download
cover image: 'view of edinburgh with the castle and aethers seat' by an unknown artis of the 19th century Scottish School.

trackinfo.credits: from above the city a symbol (the arthur's seat coffins), released October 19, 2020

elizabeth veldon.title: adieu to old england, adieu,
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
at the beginning of next week i will pack up my studio to move to edinburgh and begin my studies. as such this may well be the final piece i publish while living here in the highlands.
when last traveling to the central belt i began humming this song quietly to myself so thought it was the perfect compliment to the emotions on walking away from a not always pleasant chapter in my life.
Adieu to Old England, adieu,
And adieu to some hundreds of pounds.
If the world had been ended when I had been young,
My sorrows I'd never have known
Once I could drink of the best,
The very best brandy and rum.
Now I am glad of a cup of spring water
That flows from town to town.
Once I could eat of good bread,
Good bread that was made of good wheat.
Now I am glad with a hard mouldy crust
And glad that I got it to eat.
Once I could lie on a good bed,
A good bed that was made of soft down.
Now I am glad of a clot of clean straw
To keep myself from the cold ground.
Once I could ride in my carriage,
With servants to drive me along.
Now I'm in prison, in prison so strong
Not knowing which way I can turn.
(repeat first verse)

trackinfo.title: adieu to old england, adieu,
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from adieu to old england, adieu,, released August 25, 2021

elizabeth veldon.title: after a period of silence
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
the title of this album has some irony attached to it as my output has been limited for the last couple of years.
i was made homeless after loosing my tenancy in the flat I lived in during my masters and have only now secured permanent accommodation.
since moving a few weeks ago i have been meaning to make some music and only had a chance to do so today when the unpacking had progressed to the point where this was possible.

elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
but all the dignity you can muster
can only give you back a mouth to feed
and rent to pay if what you loose in bluster
is no more than win patience with 'i need'
while distant blackboards use you as their duster
from 'glasgow sonnet no. 5' by edwin morgan
this is the first in a series of works dealing with communities possibly or defiantly impacted by political developments since the eu referendum in the uk.
this discusses my homeland, scotland

elizabeth veldon.title: all the rest have thirty one (in memory of laetitia)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album is for Laetitia, an artist I worked with an published (under the name Ars Sonor) who killed herself in January after suffering sustained attacks from the far right.
the album references two poems (''in memory of major robert gregory' by w b yeats and 'dead man's dump' by isaac rosenberg) as well as some work we did together, alchemy and magical numbers along with random thoughts and memories that came to me as i compiled the piece.
i long for a time when being queer does not mean loosing people to suicide and an early death.
please seek help when you need it, please reach out to those you love and never loose your anger and hunger for justice.
for laetitia as she passes through the outermost spheres

elizabeth veldon.title: an alternitive soundtrack to 'the great white silence'
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
the tracks here included are intended to soundtrack ‘the great white silence’ but are not intended to cover the length of the film or to be understood as being intended for any particular section of the film.
the individual tracks are intended to allow the viewer to score the film, to select tracks to play at any point they wish and for said tracks to be layered in any way they wish.
they are constructed as part of an imagined dvd which would allow this feature

elizabeth veldon.title: an anglo-saxon songbook part 3. charms and spells (for james wise, magus)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this series of eps is intended to destroy a myth put around by british fascist groups that the pre-norman british where 'true' british.
they where not, they where just like us: they liked a dirty joke, a little cry over a sad story, feared for their futures and tried to make sense of their lifes.
the first ep delt with dirty jokes, the second with sad stories and this ep has charms to (in the order of the tracks) ensure an easy pregnancy, to stop wren's nesting in their properties and to keep their lands fertile.
they where no square jawed northern europeans.
made with a macbook pro, ipads, a mininova, theremin and zed sixty 10fx
never trust other's story of your history.

elizabeth veldon.title: an eala bhàn (fort george 11/08/17)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
fort george was created after the battle of culloden as a centre for the british government's campaign against the gaelic people and culture and the deliberate campaign of ethnic cleansing carried out across the highlands.
the fort later became the home of the highland regiments.
this album was inspired my a visit to the fort.
the title comes from dòmhnall ruadh chorùna's song of the same title written during the somme
An Eala Bhàn
Gur duilich leam mar tha mi
‘S mo chridhe ‘n sas aig bron
Bhon an uair a dh’fhag mi
Beanntan ard a’ cheo
Gleanntannan a’mhanrain
Nan loch, nam bagh ‘s nan srom
‘S an eala bhan tha tamh ann
Gach la air ‘m bheil mi ‘n toir.
A Mhagaidh na bi tursach
A ruin, ged gheibhinn bas-
Co am fear am measg an t-sluaigh
A mhaireas buan gu brath?
Chan eil sinn uile ach air chuairt
Mar dhithein buaile fas
Bheir siantannan na blianna sios
‘S nach tog a’ ghrian an aird.
Tha ‘n talamh leir mun cuairt dhiom
‘Na mheallan suas ‘s na neoil;
Aig na ‘shells a’ bualadh –
Cha leir dhomh bhuam le ceo:
Gun chlaisneachd aig mo chluasan
Le fuaim a’ ghunna mhoir;
Ach ged tha ‘n uair seo cruaidh orm
Tha mo smuaintean air NicLeoid.
Air m’ uilinn anns na truinnsichean
Tha m’ inntinn ort, a ghraidh;
Nam chadal bidh mi a’ bruadar ort
Cha dualach dhomh bhith slan;
Tha m’ aigne air a lionadh
Le cianalas cho lan
‘S a’ghruag a dh’fhas cho ruadh orm
A nis air thuar bhith ban
Oidhche mhath leat fhein, a ruin
Nad leabaidh chubhraidh bhlath;
Cadal samhach air a chul
Do dhusgadh sunndach slan
Tha mise ‘n seo ‘s an truinnsidh fhuar
‘S nam chluasan fuaim bhais
Gun duil ri faighinn as le buaidh –
Tha ‘n cuan cho buan ri shnamh.
The White Swan
Sad I consider my condition
With my heart engaged with sorrow
From the very time that I left
The high bens of the mist
The little glens of dallaince
Of the lochans, the bays and the forelands
And the white swan dwelling there
Whom I daily pursue.
Maggie, don’t be sad
Love, if I should die –
Who among men
Endures eternally?
We are all only on a journey
Like flowers in the deserted cattle fold
That the year’s wind and rain will bring down
And that the sun cannot raise.
All the ground around me
Is like hail in the heavens;
With the shells exploding –
I am blinded by smoke:
My ears are deafened
By the roar of the cannon;
But despite the savagery of the moment
My thoughts are on the girl called MacLeod.
Crouched in the trenches
My mind is fixed on you, love;
In sleep I dream of you
I am not fated to survive;
My spirit is filled
With a surfeit of longing
And my hair once so auburn
Is now almost white.
Goodnight to you, love
In your warm, sweet-smelling bed;
May you have peaceful sleep and afterwards
May you waken healthy and in good spirits
I am here in the cold trench
With the clamour of death in my ears
With no hope of returning victorious-
The ocean is too wide to swim.
elizabeth veldon.credits:
released August 13, 2017
photographs on the cover: two stained glass windows from the fort's chapel

trackinfo.credits: from an eala bhàn (fort george 11/08/17), released August 13, 2017

elizabeth veldon.title: an elegy for fred phelps
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.
rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.
be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.
recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.
if it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.
dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.
be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
(romans 12: 14-21)

elizabeth veldon.title: and here is the ring that was broken between us in the midst of all danger, love, to remind me of you
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this was suggested by june tabor's singing of 'the plains of waterloo'
As I rode out one fine summer's morning
Down by the gay banks of a clear pearling stream,
There I spied a handsome fair maid making sad lamentations,
Oh, I threw myself in ambush to hear her sad strains.
Through the woods she marched along, caused the valleys to ring-o,
The fine feathered songsters around her they flew,
Saying, “The wars they are all over and peace it is restored again,
But yet my Willie's not returning from the plains of Waterloo.”
Well, I stepped up to this fair maid and said, “My fond creature,
Oh, may I make so bold as to ask your true love's name?
For it's I've been in battle where the cannons around rattle
And by some strange fortune I might have known the same.”
“Willie Smith me true love's name is, hero of great fame,
He's gone and he's left me in sorrow, it's true.
No-one shall me enjoy but me own darling boy,
But yet he's not returning from the plains of Waterloo.”
“Well, if Willie Smith's your true love's name, he's a hero of great fame,
He and I have been in battle through many's the long campaign.
Through Italy and Russia, through Germany and Prussia,
Oh, he was me loyal comrade through France and through Spain.”
“Until at length by the French we were surrounded,
Like the heroes of old we did them subdue.
We did fight for three days until we did defeat him,
That brave Napoleon Boney on the plains of Waterloo.”
“Now the eighteenth day of June, it is end of that battle,
Leaving many's the bold hero to sigh and to mourn.
Oh, the war drums they did beat and the cannons around did rattle,
It was by a French soldier your Willie he was slain.”
“And as I passed by there where he lay a-bleeding,
Oh, I scarcely had time for to bid him adieu.
In a faltering voice these words he was repeating,
Fare the well, me lovely Annie, you are far from Waterloo.“
Now when this lovely fair maid heard this sad acclamation
Oh, but her rosy cheeks turned pale and wan.
And when I saw this fair maid making sad lamentations,
Oh, I said, “Me lovely Annie, I am that very one.”
“And here is the ring that was broken between us,
In the midst of all danger, love, to remind me of you.”
And when she saw the token, she fell into me arms crying,
“You're welcome, dearest Willie, from the plains of Waterloo.”

trackinfo.title: and here is the ring that was broken between us in the midst of all danger, love, to remind me of you
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from and here is the ring that was broken between us in the midst of all danger, love, to remind me of you, released August 19, 2017

elizabeth veldon.title: and if any question why we lived we will reply 'for the one million acts of kindness we could bestow, the fragments of compassion, the love and the hope of easing the pain of others. for this and a million other reasons'
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album is for faze exile who's sister recently died after after battling breast cancer.
according to figures released by cancer research uk cancers are responsible for one in four deaths in the uk and almost eight million people worldwide died from cancer in 2008.
all money raised from this release be donated to cancer research uk:  www.cancerresearchuk.org
this release is now available for free.

And will he not come again?
And will he not come again?
No, no, he is dead:
Go to thy death-bed:
He never will come again.
His beard was as white as snow,
All flaxen was his poll:
He is gone, he is gone,
And we cast away moan:
God ha' mercy on his soul!
And of all Christian souls, I pray God. God be wi' ye.

elizabeth veldon.title: antiquities
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album is inspired by recent events in egypt, particularly the use of the present situation to loot antiquities.
the same pattern of events where observed in iraq after the fall of saddam hussein.
the first track refers to a guardian statue placed in the tomb of ramses 1 and the second to the director general of excavations and antiquities for the egyptian government (who first sought to halt the illegal trade in antiquities and preserve relics of ancient egyptian culture for egypt. his work resulted in the founding of the egyptian museum in cairo in 1902.

i am way beyond the global mortality age for trans*people, people i knew at university have died before they reached this age and my brother died when he was 37 so i have reached a milestone he can never achieve.

this is a lengthy field recording made today, boxing day 2016, in my garden shed so i could record the passing storm.
it ends with me coming to turn the recorded off and talking loudly to any animals which may have been in the garden or near the shed so they didn't get a fright from my presence.

elizabeth veldon.about:
this album is about the merkinch nature reserve in inverness.
the witches grave pool is a pool containing the foundations of a large crane which becomes visible at low tide and herons are common in the reserve.
this is housed close to the beauly firth and one of the poorest estates in inverness but also one of the most vibrant communities.
www.merkinchlnr.org.uk

elizabeth veldon.title: because you love to be with me as i make music i make this song to help you sleep
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
'Veldon allows pure electronic tones to corrode, morph, or collapse altogether. Hearing the change is like trying to notice the growth in a sequoia from one second to the next. This 30-minute piano piece has a similar ethos. Veldon hunts and pecks through a stunted melody, pauses, and eventually resumes. Will it ever evolve or resolve? She simply returns to it, the dynamics shifting slightly as the tape hiss trickles past like the sound of a distant stream. You hang on every repeated phrase and wait for some revelation, only to disappear alongside Veldon in the end.'
daily.bandcamp.com/lists/music-designed-to-help-you-sleep

elizabeth veldon.title: behold a fourth beast, dreadful and terrible, and strong exceedingly; and it had great iron teeth (the gorbals vampire)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
hello and welcome to my halloween albums for 2020.
this year i'll be discussing scottish urban legends and high strangeness and we begin with a craze among school children in 1950's glasgow where they hunted a seven foot tall vampire with iron teeth.
don't worry, the other iron toothed legend from glasgow will make an appearance too.
the story comes with a piece from the scotsman and some contempory newspaper clippings taken from:  www.glasgowfamilyhistory.org.uk/blog/Pages/Vampire-in-the-Southern-Necropolis.aspx

this is the fifth in a series of reissues of whole albums from my now defunct 'black circle records' label.
tracks 1 - 3 from 'left/ right (for peetura)' (elizabeth Veldon and Peetura) released 10th of febuary, 2014.
track one is my interpretation of the score, track two Peetura's and track three is both together. the scores and instructions are included with the download.
original release notes as follows:
his track came about from a discussion about transposing ideas in psychology as music.
this track is one of two ideas and is based upon the idea of seeing the brain as a computer, in this case a duel processor on where the left and right hemispheres work independently.
included in the download is the score and instructions for interpreting it given to the artists.
tracks 4 - 9 are from 'commit your voice to the ether before everything is lost' (elizabeth Veldon and The Implicit Order) released on the 18th of december 2012.
source sounds from analogue media where provided by The Implicit Order and interpreted by myself
this album was issued as a cdr in unmarked, distressed brown card covers. a photograph of one is included with the download

elizabeth veldon.title: by easter carbeth, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered zion
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
given the recent issues over britain in europe and even the continued existence of britain as an entity i find identities i have held all my life pass from me and there's nothing i can do.
this piece concerns these feelings of loosing that which ties me to place: my identities as a european and as a british person
if i forget thee, o jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.
if i do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not jerusalem above my chief joy.

elizabeth veldon.title: c j wills (md) laments the discomfort of his riding  boots and afterwards mentions the condition of the jewish people in 19th century persia but mostly laments the condition of his boots
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album refers to 'land of the lion and sun, or modern persia being experiences of life in persia from 1866 to 1881' by c j wills'
the passages dealing with the position of jews in persian society can be found on pp 52 and 74:
'as to the jews, their position is terrible. probably in no country of the world are they treated worse than in persia. beaten, despised and oppressed, cursed even by slaves and children, they yet manage to exist, earning their living as musicians, dancers, singers, jewellers, silver- and goldsmiths, midwifes, makers and sellers of wines and spirits. when anything very filthy is to be done a jew is sent for.' p. 74
complaints about his riding boots are numerous.

elizabeth veldon.title: christ reborn as twins on the streets of cambridge
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album relates to the story of a homeless woman giving birth to twins outside trinity collage in cambridge (  www.cambridge-news.co.uk/news/cambridge-news/homeless-woman-birth-premature-twins-17471458?fbclid=IwAR0mrYnStTZadJBZgHjv9gTYsLH8tUFMjjw0cZH5oWgKYsrKpyYv-LpaTso  )
trinity is the richest collage in the uk and has many billions of pounds worth of assets and the disparity that allowed a homeless woman to give birth outside it's gates is symptomatic of our society.
there is a fund raiser for the woman (  www.justgiving.com/crowdfunding/homeless-new-mother?fbclid=IwAR3woxVNF9STD3qiFbc2dze407mQT3grcO9irF6ACNLahZ1VAU_svpNqrG4  ) or you can donate to a homeless charity of your choosing either in cambridge or in your own city or town.
this album is free to download, spend your money on those in need

elizabeth veldon.title: computer music revisited
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album was published on black circle records and described there as follows:
last year a collection of tapes was released on black circle which including a release called 'computer music' between myself and tothelovers farewell which used the zx plectrum app.
tothelovers afterwards turned to far right politics and his contribution has been removed from the album and the creator of the zx plectrum app has promoted his hate speech.
this is a reinvention of the release using the yellofier app.
this release used lots of clipping and sharp, clean snare drum sounds.
black circle encourages the death of fascism through joy, dance your way to a fascist free world. join the anti-faschist bacchanalian reverie.
the last one on the dancefloor is a fellow traveler.
download here:  blackcirclerecords.bandcamp.com/album/computer-music-revisited

elizabeth veldon.title: cuidus contrarium verum est: a life of christine the astonishing (chapters eleven to fifteen)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is the third of a series of seven releases based upon thomas of cantimpre's life of christine the astonishing.
the title comes from a medieval carol i first came across in power's 'medieval women' (Cambridge University Press, 1975) which posits that women are full of deceit and violence and translates (roughly) as 'the opposite is true.'
the oppositions between christine's position as a powerful and holy woman in the medieval period and the contemporary attempts to diagnose her in her absence with schizophrenia and/ or epilepsy is the main thrust of these albums: cuidus contrarium verum est
in creating this work i used elizabeth spearling's translation from 'Medieval Writings on Female Sexuality' (Penguin, 2002.)
in addition i used works by Barbara Newman and Eileen Power as well as dipping into Foucault's 'Madness and Civilisation.'

trackinfo.title: chapter eleven: just as an arrow flies faster the harder the bow is drawn, so her spirit thrust directly upward along with her own body in its true fleshy state, as it is said, and flew out like a bird in the air
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from cuidus contrarium verum est: a life of christine the astonishing (chapters eleven to fifteen), released March 22, 2021

trackinfo.title: chapter twelve: for her maiden breasts began to flow with a liquid which was the sweetest oil
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from cuidus contrarium verum est: a life of christine the astonishing (chapters eleven to fifteen), released March 22, 2021

trackinfo.title: chapter thirteen: because of the way that Christine fled from the presence of men, and climbed onto high things like a bird, and stayed in the water for a long time like a bird
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from cuidus contrarium verum est: a life of christine the astonishing (chapters eleven to fifteen), released March 22, 2021

trackinfo.title: chapter fourteen: and finding the baptismal font uncovered, she plunged herself into it completely
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from cuidus contrarium verum est: a life of christine the astonishing (chapters eleven to fifteen), released March 22, 2021

trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from cuidus contrarium verum est: a life of christine the astonishing (chapters eleven to fifteen), released March 22, 2021

elizabeth veldon.title: defining place by it's dislocation
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this track is based on a field recording of an air conditioning unit at the inverness campus of the highlands and islands university. it has been treated to remove anything that ties it to a place, has been pitch shifted and a number of other processes.
'this goodly frame, the earth, seems to me a sterile promontory'
headphones are recommended.

elizabeth veldon.title: dies natalis solis invicti
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
'dies natalis solis invicti' the birth of the unconquered sun.
this was the chief date in the worship of 'sol invictus' believed to have been held on the 25th of december though there is no proof of this having been celebrated before the fourth century.
photograph taken: kyber fields, mugdock county park near milngavie on dies natalis solis invicti, 2012

elizabeth veldon.title: disembodiment/ embodiment (24 figures for alex)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this piece came about after discussing a paper with alex temple which discussed trans embodiment in music. we both felt that the paper had multiple issues and this is a reductio ad absurdum regarding one of them.
if a jokes worth making once it's worth making 23 times
so i didn't explain the joke and, in retrospect, that's not funny.
the paper made repeated snipes at post-structuralism but set up multiple binary oppositions which had barley surpassed value judgements attached to this. in this album i wanted to show how rediculious this approach is. even the title is itself a binary opposition but one that has had it's terms reversed and to understand why that's a thing you're going to have to read some french stuff.

elizabeth veldon.title: down at the old bull and bush (I'n memoriam  tina hibbins)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
it was with sadness that i today learned that the artist, dj and queer rights activist tina hibbins has passed away.
i wrote music based upon her memories of sex workers in london and had admired her wit and commitment to social justice.
sadly i never got round to working with her to recreate photographs of soldiers taken before going to the front in ww1
this album is based upon jolly music hall songs. i think she would enjoy the joke

elizabeth veldon.title: drawing the sortes
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album references the m r james story 'the ash tree'
"So much is to be said of the Symptoms seen on the Corpse. As to what I am to add, it is meerly my own Experiment, and to be left to Posterity to judge whether there be anything of Value therein. There was on the Table by the Beddside a Bible of the small size, in which my Friend punctuall as in Matters of less Moment, so in this more weighty one — used nightly, and upon his First Rising, to read a sett Portion. And I taking it up — not without a Tear duly paid to him which from the Study of this, poorer Adumbration was now pass'd to the contemplation of its great Originall — it came into my Thoughts, as at such moments of Helplessness we are prone to catch at any the least Glimmer that makes promise of Light, to make trial of that old and by many accounted Superstitious Practice of drawing the Sortes: of which a Princapall Instance, in the case of his late Sacred Majesty the Blessed Martyr King Charles and my Lord Falkland, was now much talked of. I must needs admit that by my Trial not much Assistance was afforded me: yet, as the Cause and Origin of these Dreadful Events may hereafter be search'd out, I set down the Results, in the case it may be found that they pointed the true Quarter of the Mischief to a quicker Intelligence than my own.
"I made, then, three trials, opening, the Book and placing my Finger upon certain words: which gave in the first these words, from Luke xiii. 7, Cut it down; in the second, Isaiah xiii. 20, It shall never be inhabited; and upon the third Experiment; Job xxxix. 30, Her young ones also suck up blood."
elizabeth veldon.credits:
released February 9, 2016
still taken from lawrence gordon clark's adaptation of 'the ash tree (photography by john mcglashan)

elizabeth veldon.title: Du mußt nicht die Nacht in dir verschränken mußt sie ins ew'ge Licht versenken (transgender day of remembrance 2020)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this takes it's title and the title of the pieces from the texts by Rückert set by Mahler in the Kindertotenlieder
the title translates as 'You must not fold the night into yourself./ You must bathe it in eternal light.'
the first track 'ah, too soon/ extinguished joyful light' and the final track 'frightened by no storm,/ sheltered by the Hand of God.'
'If one member suffers, all suffer together with it; if one member is honoured, all rejoice together with it.'
1 Corinthians 12: 26

elizabeth veldon.title: early works/ noise works
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album contains selections from some albums i withdrew and am finally deleting forever. i mainly produced harsh noise in my early career and this is what i consider the best of the work
1-3: from 'i will fill the pit of hell with jinn and men: a prayer against muslimgauze'
4-6 from 'all the pretty faces must needs go underground (for glen campbell)'
tracks 9 onwards was 'flow my tears (notes towards a new politics)' my response to the london riots of 2011 and use found footage from news broadcasts

elizabeth veldon.title: en meditativ fred för laetitia schteinberg
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
laetitia schteinberg is a woman with a transexual history, a gifted musician, graphic designer and queer rights campaigner who fled from russia and now faces possible deportation from sweden.
laetitia schteinberg is also a personal friend.
if you listen to or download this album sign the petition to ask the swedish authorities to allow her leave to stay. her final hearing will be on the 26th of this month. do not desert her, do not desert the others in the same position as her:
www.change.org/petitions/save-laetitia-a-transwoman-being-deportated-to-russia

elizabeth veldon.title: encompass me in your eyes' wild calm
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is a companion piece to 'like falling forever'
the title comes from j f hendry's poem 'the constant north'
encompass me, my lover,
with your eyes' wide calm.
though noonday shadows are assembling doom,
the sun remains when i remember them;
and death, if it should come,
must fall like quiet snow from such clear skies.
minutes we snatched from the unkind winds
are grown into daffodils by the sea's
edge, mocking its green miseries;
yet i seek you hourly still, over
a new atlantis loneliness, blind
as a restless needle held by the constant north we always have in mind.
the album was intended as a singe 50 minute track (to mirror 'like falling forever') but had to be split into two parts due to problems with my internet connection
both albums feature cover art based around images from the apollo mission archives  www.flickr.com/photos/projectapolloarchive/

my voice is not great but i wanted to explore themes of class and gender in british folk song.
more reading on the folk collectors and their silencing of the urban poor and women's erotic fantasies can be found in Georgina Boyes fantastic book 'The Imagined Village'

elizabeth veldon.title: fear not: for i have redeemed thee, i have called thee by thy name; thou art mine
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album concerns the building of a place of worship in one of refugee camps in callias
'but now thus saith the lord that created thee, o jacob, and he that formed thee, o israel, fear not: for i have redeemed thee, i have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.
when thou passest through the waters, i will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
for i am the lord thy god, the holy one of israel, thy saviour: i gave Egypt for thy ransom, ethiopia and seba for thee.
since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and i have loved thee: therefore will i give men for thee, and people for thy life.
fear not: for i am with thee: i will bring thy seed from the east, and gather thee from the west;
i will say to the north, give up; and to the south, keep not back: bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth;
even every one that is called by my name: for i have created him for my glory, i have formed him; yea, i have made him.'
isaiah 43:1-7

1. the beautician
2. the reassurance
3. to the dead owner of a gym

snow blows out toward them, till their seat
filling with flakes becomes instead
snow-bank, snow-landscape, and in that
they find themselves with all the dead

elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
so first of all let me assert my firm belief that the only thing we have to fear is fear itself—nameless, unreasoning, unjustified terror which paralyzes the needed effort to convert retreat into advance.
fdr

elizabeth veldon.title: fools for christ: towards a study of christine the astonishing
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is a provisional study towards a lengthy work on the christian visionary christina the astonishing which will be released in seven instalments over the coming months.
at the moment i am researching female christian visionaries and christina in more detail and this is a reaction after reading thomas of cantimpre's life of christinia after several years of not having access to the text.
the title refers to a particular group of visionaries also known as 'holy fools' and the name is derived from 1 corinthians 4: 10
We are fools for Christ, but you are so wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are honored, we are dishonored!
headphones are required (or playing it through speakers)

elizabeth veldon.title: for ariana grande in recognition of her desperation
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
I've been intending to write this piece for some time. It refers to newspaper stories about ariana grande suffering from depression.
to often we celebrate male artists being open regarding their mental health but when women speak about the same issues they are attacked for discussing their emotional life beyond conventional norms.
'Veldon’s groaning cycles of metallic phase are as impenetrable as they are edgeless, seeping out to fill all available space. The smothering vapour is a great analogue for the disempowering fog of mental illness, its unchanging carapace also (paradoxically) evoking an austerity regime that brooks no debate as it dismembers mental health support services. As Veldon knows, Ariana Grande isn’t alone in her desperation.'
weneednoswords.wordpress.com/2019/05/08/elizabeth-veldon-for-ariana-grande-in-recognition-of-her-desperation/

elizabeth veldon.title: for charlie and ibrahim that they lie in the same grave
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
charlie was a captive elephant (the then largest in captivity) who lived with his keeper and companion ibrahim at craigend zoo near milngavie.
when the zoo closed down in 1955 they moved to the butlins in ayr and then on to yorkshire where charlie became distraught and, eventually, violent after the death of ibrahim and was put down in 1961
i like to imagine that charley and ibrahim where at their happiest in craigend and their relationship shows that humans and other animals can have friendships which are deep and meaningful but, in the end, charlie's story was tragic. charlie belonged in the wild, not in captivity.
'work with animals is a source of suffering to all of us. we treat them like babies who cannot speak'
oleg gazenko
www.milngavieherald.co.uk/news/local-headlines/the-elephant-we-ll-never-forget-1-213554
murderiseverywhere.blogspot.co.uk/2014/05/the-greatness-of-nation-can-be-judged.html
'The opening track is not what I expected – most people associate elizabeth with long form, minimalist drone. This opening track, “charlie and ibrahim are walking in milngavie and a band is playing”, is a piano piece. And, a beautiful piano piece at that. Abstract and verging on Dada – I believe – but very on point and sentient. The opening track sets the emotion encumbered with such an album. The second track is a nostalgic look at fun times in the distant past. Almost the memory of a dream is evoked through the use of sparse timing and playful, water-like strokes of the keys.
However, it is the impossibly long titled final track (“we raised a tomb for charlie and ibrahim so they may lie together as they did in mugdock and know the joy of companionship until all things pass. and that we may know this also”) that steals the show. As the title of the track concludes, it is not a rag-time show stopper. This lament on a piano is a sparsely populated, almost silent track.'
www.theparishnews.com/2016/09/elizabeth-veldon-for-charlie-and-ibrahim-that-they-lie-in-the-same-grave/

elizabeth veldon.title: for i will consider my cat nickholas
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this track is an interpretation of the famous fragment from jubilate agno 'for i will consider my cat jeoffry' by christopher smart and is dedicated to our own joyful eruption of light and goodness nicky
this uses piano, analogue synthesiser and objects (including but not limited to a portable radio, masking tape, nail scissors, camera and ink bottle)

trackinfo.title: for i will consider my cat nickholas
trackinfo.lyrics: Jubilate Agno, Fragment B, [For I will consider my Cat Jeoffry] Christopher Smart, 1722 - 1771 For I will consider my Cat Jeoffry. For he is the servant of the Living God, duly and daily serving him. For at the first glance of the glory of God in the East he worships in his way. For is this done by wreathing his body seven times round with elegant quickness. For then he leaps up to catch the musk, which is the blessing of God upon his prayer. For he rolls upon prank to work it in. For having done duty and received blessing he begins to consider himself. For this he performs in ten degrees. For first he looks upon his forepaws to see if they are clean. For secondly he kicks up behind to clear away there. For thirdly he works it upon stretch with the forepaws extended. For fourthly he sharpens his paws by wood. For fifthly he washes himself. For sixthly he rolls upon wash. For seventhly he fleas himself, that he may not be interrupted upon the beat. For eighthly he rubs himself against a post. For ninthly he looks up for his instructions. For tenthly he goes in quest of food. For having considered God and himself he will consider his neighbor. For if he meets another cat he will kiss her in kindness. For when he takes his prey he plays with it to give it a chance. For one mouse in seven escapes by his dallying. For when his day’s work is done his business more properly begins. For he keeps the Lord’s watch in the night against the adversary.  For he counteracts the powers of darkness by his electrical skin and glaring eyes. For he counteracts the Devil, who is death, by brisking about the life. For in his morning orisons he loves the sun and the sun loves him. For he is of the tribe of Tiger. For the Cherub Cat is a term of the Angel Tiger. For he has the subtlety and hissing of a serpent, which in goodness he suppresses. For he will not do destruction if he is well-fed, neither will he spit without provocation. For he purrs in thankfulness when God tells him he’s a good Cat. For he is an instrument for the children to learn benevolence upon. For every house is incomplete without him, and a blessing is lacking in the spirit. For the Lord commanded Moses concerning the cats at the departure of the Children of Israel from Egypt. For every family had one cat at least in the bag. For the English Cats are the best in Europe. For he is the cleanest in the use of his forepaws of any quadruped. For the dexterity of his defense is an instance of the love of God to him exceedingly. For he is the quickest to his mark of any creature. For he is tenacious of his point. For he is a mixture of gravity and waggery. For he knows that God is his Saviour. For there is nothing sweeter than his peace when at rest.  For there is nothing brisker than his life when in motion.  For he is of the Lord’s poor, and so indeed is he called by benevolence perpetually--Poor Jeoffry! poor Jeoffry! the rat has bit thy throat. For I bless the name of the Lord Jesus that Jeoffry is better.  For the divine spirit comes about his body to sustain it in complete cat. For his tongue is exceeding pure so that it has in purity what it wants in music. For he is docile and can learn certain things. For he can sit up with gravity, which is patience upon approbation. For he can fetch and carry, which is patience in employment. For he can jump over a stick, which is patience upon proof positive. For he can spraggle upon waggle at the word of command. For he can jump from an eminence into his master’s bosom. For he can catch the cork and toss it again. For he is hated by the hypocrite and miser. For the former is afraid of detection.  For the latter refuses the charge. For he camels his back to bear the first notion of business. For he is good to think on, if a man would express himself neatly. For he made a great figure in Egypt for his signal services. For he killed the Icneumon rat, very pernicious by land. For his ears are so acute that they sting again. For from this proceeds the passing quickness of his attention. For by stroking of him I have found out electricity. For I perceived God’s light about him both wax and fire. For the electrical fire is the spiritual substance which God sends from heaven to sustain the  bodies both of man and beast. For God has blessed him in the variety of his movements. For, though he cannot fly, he is an excellent clamberer. For his motions upon the face of the earth are more than any other quadruped. For he can tread to all the measures upon the music. For he can swim for life. For he can creep.
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from for i will consider my cat nickholas, released September 30, 2014

elizabeth veldon.title: for the birds on st valentines day
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
based upon the medieval belief that birds started mating on valantine's day, the source of our celebration of the day
the second track is based upon chaucer's lyric:
Now welcome summer with thy sunne soft,
Now welcome summer with thy sunne soft,
That hast this winter`s weather overshake,
And driven away the longe nightes black.
Saint Valentine, that art full high on loft,
Thus singen smalle fowles for thy sake:
Now welcome summer with thy sunne soft,
That hast this winter`s weathers overshake.
Well have they cause for to gladden oft,
Well have they cause for to gladden oft,
Since each of them recovered hath his make.
Full blissful may they singen when they wake:
Now welcome summer with thy sunne soft,
Now welcome summer with thy sunne soft,
That hast this winter`s weather overshake,
And driven away the longe nightes black.

elizabeth veldon.title: four gestures towards a lost girlhood
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
i've recently been arguing allot with people online about the rights of trans children to socially transition and, upon puberty, access hormone blockers.
this has led to a period of me mourning the girlhood i was never allowed and this piece explores the emotions involved in this.
make no mistake: i am genderqueer and wish to see a radical decentring of gender within the present discourse but i still mourn for the girlhood i was never allowed.

elizabeth veldon.title: four short fighting songs for the swing kids (for daniel)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
the swing kids where a german youth counter cultural group who loved swing music and spoke their own form of slang.
as the crack down on freedoms in nazi germany intensified they became more politicised and even formed loose connections with the white rose movement.
many swing kids where taken to concentration camps for, basically, loving jazz.
more info:
swungover.wordpress.com/2013/07/26/swingjugend-the-real-swing-kids/
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swing_Kids
thank you to the artist ship canal for alerting me to the existence of this group. i hope this can go some way towards creating the body of jazz music that should exist to lionise this group.

elizabeth veldon.title: four songs, burning
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
NACHTWACHE
'Watchman, what of the night?'
'I've heard the owl repeat
Its hollow prescient note,
The bat shriek at its hunting,
The water-snake rustle
Under the pond's soaked leaves.
I have heard vinous voices,
Stammering, angry, as I drowsed
In the tavern near the chapel.
I have heard lovers' whispers, laughter,
And the labored breathing of absolved longings,
Adolescents murmuring in their dreams,
Others tossing, sleepless from desire.
I've seen silent heat-lightning,
The terror every night
Of the girl who lost her way
And doesn't know bed from coffin.
I've heard the hoarse panting
Of a lonely old man struggling with death,
A woman torn in labor,
The cry of a just-born child.
Stretch out and sleep, citizen.
Everything is in order; this night is half over."
10 August 1983

elizabeth veldon.title: from 'how shall we sing the lord's song in a strange land: five psalms'
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album was originally conceived as a score for performance on the 1905 lewis organ at glasgow university but was never realised.
in the light of the recent refugee crisis my interest in the psalms has shifted from themes of exile and cultural estrangement towards echoing the unimaginable suffering of these refugees.
this is the worst crisis since the end of world war two and we must not turn away from those who need our help.
i do not intend to raise money from this release or tell you where to give or how to give your time; i ask you to look on those in pain and see others like yourself, like those you love.
the selection ends with a setting of the first words of psalm 130. i leave you with wyatt's translation of that psalm:
FROM depth of sin, and from a deep despair,
From depth of death, from depth of heart’s sorrow,
From this deep cave, of darkness deep repair,
Thee have I called, O Lord, to be my borrow.
Thou in my voice, O Lord, perceive and hear
My heart, my hope, my plaint, my overthrow,
My will to rise: and let by grant appear,
That to my voice thine ears do well attend;
No place so far, that to Thee is not near;
No depth so deep, that thou ne mayst extend
Thine ear thereto; hear then my woful plaint:
For, Lord, if thou observe what men offend,
And put thy native mercy in restraint;
If just exaction demand recompense;
Who may endure, O Lord? who shall not faint
At such accompt? so dread, not reverence
Should reign at large. But thou seekest rather love
For in thy hand is Mercy’s residence;
By hope whereof Thou dost our hearts eke move.
I in the Lord have set my confidence:
My soul such trust doth evermore approve:
Thy holy word of eterne excellence,
Thy mercy’s promise, that is alway just,
Have been my stay, my pillar, and defence.
My soul in God hath more desirous trust,
Than hath the watchman looking for the day,
For his relief, to quench of sleep the thrust.
Let Israel trust unto the Lord alway;
For grace and favour are his property:
Plenteous ransom shall come with him, I say,
And shall redeem all our iniquity.

elizabeth veldon.title: from Laika & Other Works
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
' ‘Laika and other works’ is a gathering of releases by Elizabeth Veldon – comprised of two and a half hours’ worth of piano compositions, drone recitals and spoken word monologues, the set includes the complete sets ‘Laika’ and ‘Milton Road to Nepal (For Ghoti)’ as well as ”The Scottish Fisheries’, ‘Darwin Cut Ups for Hobart’, ‘We Will Never Leave You’ and a brand-new companion piece to ‘Laika’. Really is a most intimate reading, which for now our ears have locked upon the chamber tones of ‘over the water’ which across its ten minute stay is awash in all manner of treated piano motifs and strangely abrupt metering, itself veering between moments of genteel passiveness to the turbulent eruptions which in some way, I’m minded to say, perfectly mirror and compliment the whole solemn, remote and reflectively melancholy nature of the water / sea in so much that beneath the tranquility a confused emotion rages beneath the calming surface ripples.'
marklosingtoday.wordpress.com/2017/09/06/elizabeth-veldon/
'Laika and Other Works ’is a collection of drone based pieces, short piano improvisations and spoken word cuts that showcases both the diversity and quality of Veldon’s discography. It’s all very good, basically, although the two ‘Laika’ tracks (originally released in 2015) are the highlight for me, their slices of gravely, phasing drone coming on appropriately cosmic and ominous. On ‘Like Babies Who Cannot Speak’ a recurring metronomic pulse adds an extra element of tension, as if a squad of militant woodpeckers had taken over mission control.
That things never descend into retro-hipster-kitsch (Russians! dogs! Space! Communism!) is due partly to ‘Work With Animals’, a new spoken word piece. Veldon recites then loops a quote from Oleg Georgivitch Gazenko, part of the Sputnik 2team responsible for Laika’s mission: “Work with animals is a source of suffering for all of us. We treat them like babies who cannot speak. The more time passes, the more I’m sorry about it….We did not learn enough from the mission to justify the death of the dog.”
The four sentences get more fragmented with each repetition, descending finally into a kind of heartbreaking digital gibberish. It’s short but powerful and shifts ‘Laika & Other Works’ from being a historical curio to a lament for the forgotten victims of the space race and a despairing castigation of the ways we treat those species with which we share a planet.'
radiofreemidwich.wordpress.com/tag/elizabeth-veldon/

elizabeth veldon.title: gesturing towards invasion ('between the acts' and woolf's diaries)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album is based upon virginia woolf's diaries from the time that she wrote 'between the acts' and deal with her fears of invasion
the first track is based upon her feelings at being asked to 'represent' t.s. elliot at the funeral of ottoline morell:
'i must read roger: & go to ott's memorial service, representing also t. s. elliot at his absurd command'
the fourth track takes it's title from h.d.'s 'trilogy,' one of the two great poetical works dealing with the effect of total war on a civilian population. while 'between the acts' specifically references elliot's 'four quartets' throughout the work i choose this other work to balance elliot's 'absurd command'
the other tracks deal with specific passages from her diaries, including her writing of her fears of the effect of invasion on her as a british jew (her and her husband planned to kill themselves should this happen) while the final track takes the final words of the novel.
i have taken some time to release this album as i felt it could be crass to discuss a jewish woman's fear of invasion during world war two and the third track is one i was very hesitant to give a title to.
this album, given it's subject matter, will be a 'pay what you like' release.
any parallels with the present situation in the world have to be found by the listener, i am not here to dictate your reaction.

elizabeth veldon.title: Glen Tanar
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
This album was inspired by photographs taken by the film maker, artist and sound artist Chris Dooks. the photographs where of graffiti in a barn dating from the inter-war period. 'can you do the foxtrot,' 'oh horsie...' and 'there's a kiss in store...' take their titles from the graffiti itself. the cover for this album features one of chris dooks photographs.
'It makes a perfect soundtrack to staring at the world outside a window, to penning a letter to someone special, to thinking about your place in history, to rummaging through old personal affects / artifacts, and letting the ever-present world of fantasy permeate your reality in a moment of quietude and private reflection. It would make for a brilliant accompaniment to an art film. As it evolves, it seems to fade into a light grey vortex. Barely audible bass undulates below.'
yeahiknowitsucks.wordpress.com/2014/02/06/elizabeth-veldon-glen-tanar-none/
elizabeth veldon.credits:
released November 8, 2013
Music - Elizabeth Veldon
Cover - Chris Dooks

elizabeth veldon.title: green shadow sings the songs of green shadow
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this album is one of the two works under my short lived harsh noise wall project 'green shadow' which have, by different paths, been unavailable for some time.
this album was originally published on 'red venice records' but deleted along with my other work on that label as the label owner began to flirt with fascist ideology.
it briefly became available on my own bandcamp along with another album from the same label. this album was deleted because i was unhappy that the second album had been uploaded in mono rather than stereo (even though it was recorded in stereo) and i disliked the sound quality.
this is the final incarnation of this album.

elizabeth veldon.title: he is coming (granton primary school)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
staying in edinburgh for the final part of my halloween series this relates to a story i found on redit claiming that a janitor in granton primary school had killed himself in the girl's toilets and if you slammed the door of the cubical he used it would cause the lights to flicker and summon him.
i've been unable to verify this but i like the story so i'm using it and, as we all know 'we are all stories in the end'
cover 'granton harbour and pier' from 'old and new edinburgh' published by cassell and company, 1880
have a spooky halloween

elizabeth veldon.title: here is a seed (henychesk, kherson region 24/02/22)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is my answer to the imperialist act of aggression we have witnessed from russia invading the Ukraine.
in particular this references the video of a woman in henychesk laying a curse a russian soldier:
she offers the soldier a sunflower seed (her country's national flower) and says 'put these seeds in your pocket so something wonderful grows when you die on my land'

elizabeth veldon.title: i am the collector (volume 1: landscapes)
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
with well over 300 releases on my bandcamp i decided it was time to release some themed collections for newcomers.
this collection is in chronological order and begins with my most recent release dealing with landscape and traces this thematic concern back to it's roots.
not all my landscape work is collected here as some will be included in future collections.

trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.about:
1. prelude
2. we saw horses dancing on tower road, near the kirk
3. we are caught in time, caught in this blaze of green
4. the distances we have known

6. we walked towards an age represented by the distant hills
7. walking back wrapped in the sunset

trackinfo.title: old souls torn and hung at tobar na coille
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.about:
tobar na coille, 'saint mary's well' or 'the well in the woods' is a holly well in culloden woods where people dip rags in the spring and tie them to the trees to make wishes come true.
this composition's title is a reference to charlemagne palestine's 'old souls wearing new clothes'
trackinfo.credits: from i am the collector (volume 5: another look at landscape), released June 1, 2019

trackinfo.title: bounded by water we filled this valley with graves
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.about:
this album is about the cairns at balnuaran of clava.
though only three can be seen now the site originally filled one side of the valley.
they date back almost 4,000 years
trackinfo.credits: from i am the collector (volume 5: another look at landscape), released June 1, 2019

trackinfo.title: at low tide the witches grave pool is flooded with the song of herons
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.about:
this album is about the merkinch nature reserve in inverness.
the witches grave pool is a pool containing the foundations of a large crane which becomes visible at low tide and herons are common in the reserve.
this is housed close to the beauly firth and one of the poorest estates in inverness but also one of the most vibrant communities.
www.merkinchlnr.org.uk
trackinfo.credits: from i am the collector (volume 5: another look at landscape), released June 1, 2019

trackinfo.title: our voices when raised together (ruined church, milton of clava)
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.about:
this album was inspired by the site at milton of clava where a church was built from the stones of a cairn.
this album has had three incarnations: a field recording which i was unhappy with, a piece for a circuit bent keyboard and finally this piano piece.
trackinfo.credits: from i am the collector (volume 5: another look at landscape), released June 1, 2019

trackinfo.title: if god is present god is in the woods at culloden
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.credits: from i am the collector (volume 5: another look at landscape), released June 1, 2019

trackinfo.title: a history of starvation (culloden moor, 5.03.2018)

trackinfo.title: defining place by it's dislocation
trackinfo.label: black circle records
trackinfo.about:
this track is based on a field recording of an air conditioning unit at the inverness campus of the highlands and islands university. it has been treated to remove anything that ties it to a place, has been pitch shifted and a number of other processes.
'this goodly frame, the earth, seems to me a sterile promontory'
headphones are recommended.
trackinfo.credits: from i am the collector (volume 5: another look at landscape), released June 1, 2019

elizabeth veldon.title: i am the collector (volume five): how did we get here part one
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
i wanted to take stock of where i have arrived at as an artist and decided to compile a collection of pieces which i thought showed my progress.
these tracks may show early experimentation with a particular idea or form or may be an early or more developed example of thematic concerns in my work.
this covers the years 2012 - 2015 and part two will cover 2016 until lockdown when i think my work began to consolidate as self consciously artistic.
the cover is an image of a shop i used to pass most days when i was at university in cambridge, i thought it was a fitting starting point.
all money raised from this and the second volume will go to rape crisis scotland who have suffered a sustained and vicious attack from reactionaries.

elizabeth veldon.title: i am the collector (volume five​)​: how did we get here part two
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
this is the second set of stock taking releases seeking to examine how themes and techniques have developed in my practice.
here there is a more firm development in female centred work such as 'a study towards...,' 'and then i thought...' 'raindrops/ prisms/ raindrops (for Judith) and the final track here which was used as a calling card to get on a post grad.
As with the first release all profits from this will go to rape crisis scotland as they have suffered a hate campaign from reactionaries.

elizabeth veldon.title: i am the collector (volume six:) piano works part one
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about:
It has been a while since i did an 'i am the collector' release so for the uninitiated: these are albums which republished material i have released on particuler themes or topics. This one looks at some of the work I have done for piano.
Sources:
Track 1: three spring poems
Track 2: The lilly of my heart
Track 3: six mystery plays
Track 4 and 5: a shorter protestant hymnal (for rhondalea)
Track 6: five explorations of a geomatric shape
Track 7: our lives are expressions of light (for mary)
Track 8: four short fighting songs for the swing kids (for daniel)
Track 9: five short dances from the merry muses of caledonia
Track 10: four winter impressions
Track 11: music from the film where he drempt he had died (sonatas and interludes for marie)
Track 12: a diary for holy week
Track 13: how great a loss
Track 14 and 15: ovid's metamorphosis reimagined as two remixes
Track 16: they have all gone into the world of light (for gladys)
Track 17: then be not coy (in memory of gladys patterson d, july 2015)
Track 18: oe burn my nose out on cocaine (in memory of ethyl eichelberger's jocasta)
Track 19: Two ghosts and a penance
Track 20: when i return, and to real music making, / and hear that prelude, how will irt happen then
Track 21 and 22: three dances for twilight
Track 23: i am winter
Track 24: There are foxes in the long grass boardering the fields and they are laughing
Track 25 and 26: four years of growing older than you (for thomas)
Track 27 to 29: a winter poem for sarah
Track 30: three finger exercises for arthur doyle

elizabeth veldon.title: i believe there will be saying of mass and singing of dirges, I had no notion they came so dear
elizabeth veldon.label: black circle records
elizabeth veldon.about: 'another confidence of his impressed me rather, and i sympathized with it. we had been, last year, to comminges, to see canon alberic’s tomb. it is a great marble erection with an effigy of the canon in a large wig and soutane, and an elaborate eulogy of his learning below. i saw dennistoun talking for some time with the vicar of st bertrand’s, and as we drove away he said to me: ‘i hope it isn’t wrong: you know i am a presbyterian — but i — i believe there will be “saying of mass and singing of dirges” for alberic de mauléon’s rest.’ then he added, with a touch of the northern british in his tone, ‘i had no notion they came so dear.’
